keyword: calories in a over easy egg
title: Calories in One Over Easy Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in a over easy egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for your meal planning.
h1: Calories in One Over Easy Egg
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in non-stick pan with minimal oil or spray; yolk runny, no added salt or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, frying method, added fats, and brand; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One large over easy egg has about 90 kcal and 6 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tsp butter (vs. minimal oil)

faqs.q: How many calories in a over easy egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 90 kcal for one large over easy egg.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one over easy egg?
faqs.a: About 6.3 g of protein per large egg.

faqs.q: Does frying an egg over easy add many calories?
faqs.a: Minimal added fat keeps it around 90 kcal; using butter or oil increases it.

faqs.q: How does over easy compare to boiled egg calories?
faqs.a: Similar base (~78 kcal boiled), but frying adds ~12 kcal from minimal fat.

faqs.q: Is cholesterol high in over easy eggs?
faqs.a: Yes, about 185 mg per large egg, mostly in the yolk.
